oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Pickard Family Performance P-18-A & Unknown
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: Tape 5 of 7. Two recordings of the Pickard Family (performance group) from December 8, of an unknown year and of an unknown date respectively. The first session is labeled P-18-A. Sessions are recorded in Mexico.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:creator: Pickard Family
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dcterms:tableOfContents: (00:00) All Aboard for Tennessee (Pickard Family) [Featuring voice over] -- (00:40) Bub Pickard introduces the show and Charlie introduces "I Like Mountain Music" -- (01:12) I Like Mountain Music (Pickard Family) -- (03:21) Obed and Ruthie talk about singing their music in Mexico and Charlie and Bub talk about the Mexican women-- (04:19) I Left Here in Monteray (Pickard Family) -- (06:08) Inst. Song (Pickard Family) -- (07:15) Bub touches on the Opry and the Pickard Family reflects on Ruthie's artistic side -- (08:39) I Stood on the Bridge at Midnight (Pickard Family) [Featuring Ruthie Pickard vocal] -- (11:12) Obed closing thought -- (11:28) All Aboard for Tennessee (Pickard Family)[Featuring voice over] -- (12:04) Obed greets the audience and talks about eating -- (12:29) Climbing up the Golden Stairs (Pickard Family) [Featuring Obed Pickard vocals] -- (14:59) Obed talks about people writing in about the jew's harp -- (15:55) My Pretty Quadroon (Pickard Family) -- (18:20) Obed introduces Bub (18:42) [Unidentified Instrumental] -- (19:10) Bub talks about mistaken hearing and Ruthie and Charlie introduce "The Black Mustache" -- (20:20) That Little Black Mustache (Pickard Family) [Featuring Ruthie vocals and mom and dad on piano] -- (00:00) Obed Family talk about inspiration
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: Pickard Family (Musical Group);
